snippet: There are no signs of spilled fuel, but that remains a concern as long as the Shell Oil vessel is stuck; the Coast Guard hopes to get salvage experts aboard to assess the damage.
abstract: One of Shell Oil's two Arctic drilling rigs is beached on island in Gulf of Alaska, threatening environmental damage from fuel spill and calling into question Shell's plans to resume drilling in waters north of Alaska.

byline.original: By JOHN M. BRODER and HENRY FOUNTAIN

lead_paragraph: There are no signs of spilled fuel, but that remains a concern as long as the Shell Oil vessel is stuck; the Coast Guard hopes to get salvage experts aboard to assess the damage.

headline.seo: Breakaway Oil Rig Runs Aground in Gulf of Alaska
headline.main: Rig Runs Aground in Alaska, Reviving Fears About Arctic Drilling
headline.print_headline: Rig Runs Aground in Alaska, Reviving Fears About Arctic Drilling
